nodes.bodyText: Should this be a warning instead? And "PEGA_xxx" is normally only returned with exception right? Without the exception I don't see why we want to give this code in a rate limited log
In theory, this is a "Serious problem" that they should solve, so I made it an error. But I can make this a warning if you prefer
What is the rateLimiterName used for? Do we expect CapacityAwareClient to pass the name?

Yes, it is used for logging purposes. I realized that it is very useful to know it when you throw the exception or log the warning, since otherwise you don't know the queue it was happening.
e.g. you have several services that are using the queue, but only one is the offender. How do you identify it?
It is the same concept as the threadName, without it you're completely lost at debug time

Just wondering if the queue is full, does it mean the enqueue rate and dequeue rate would be exactly the same at that point? Basically if the queue is full, we would not perform any rate limiting? Just want to get some clarification on the expected behavior.
